productType.description: Supported Products (implicit by Asset class), bound by enum type

uniqueProductId.description: The role of the Unique Product Identifier (UPI, ISO 4914)  is to uniquely identify the product involved in an OTC derivatives transaction that an authority requires, or may require in the future, to be reported to a Trade Repository (TR).

underlyingSwapProductId.description: The Unique Product Identifier (UPI, ISO4914) for the underlyingSwap

productClassificationId.description: The Classification of Financial Instruments (CFI, ISO 10962), is a six-letter-code used to classify and describe the structure and function of a financial instrument (in the form of security or contract) as part of the instrument reference data

isin.description: An International Securities Identification Number (ISIN) is a 12-digit alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies a specific security

mic.description: A market identifier code (MIC) is a four-character number used to identify stock markets and other exchanges for use in global trading and referencing computer systems.

templateName.description: The MW template name used when capturing a trade via the MW UI

calculationAgent.description:
A field to capture the calculation agent party details.
Used for CMS Spread, CMS One Look and Rate Lock

documentationDetail.description: DocumenationDetail structure used to model documentation

settlementDetail.description: RatesSettlementDetail structure used to model documentation

legType.description: One of either Fixed, Floating or FRA, used to specify the type of economic properties the swap stream represents

payer.description: A reference to the party responsible for making the payments defined by this structure

receiver.description: A reference to the party that receives the payments corresponding to this structure

buyer.description: A reference to the party buying the FRA

seller.description: A reference to the party selling the FRA

buyer.description: The party that is buying the swaption

seller.description: The party that is selling the swaption

calculationAgent.description: The ISDA calculation agent responsible for performing duties as defined in the applicable product definitions. For example, the Calculation Agent may be defined as being the Non-exercising Party.

physicalSettlementAgreedDiscountRate.description: This may be used to indicate the discount rate to be used for cash collateral for cash settlement purposes

clearedPhysicalSettlement.description: Specifies whether the swap resulting from physical settlement of the swaption transaction will clear through a clearing house. The meaning of Cleared Physical Settlement is defined in the 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 15.2 (published in Supplement number 28)

swaptionStraddle.description: Whether the option is a swaption or a swaption straddle.

swap.description: Swap structure that is the underlyer to the swaption

stream.description: Stream used for floating leg, fixed leg, fra, capfloor rates economicDetails

resetRelativeTo.description: Specifies whether the reset dates are determined with respect to each adjusted calculation period start date or adjusted calculation period end date. If the reset frequency is specified as daily this element must not be included

initialFixingDatePeriod.description: Specifies  time period and multiplier (e.g. 0,-1, -2 etc.) for the initial fixing date

initialFixingDateDayType.description: In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not. If a day type of business days is specified then non-business days are ignored when calculating the offset. The financial business centers to use for determination of business days are implied by the context in which this element is used. This element must only be included when the offset is specified as a number of days. If the offset is zero days then the dayType element should not be included

initialFixingDateBusinessDayConvention.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

initialFixingDateBusinessCenters.description: The set of business centers is used to determine whether a particular day is a business day or not

unadjustedFixingDate.description: Fixing date applicable to CMS One Look only, however fixingBusinessDayConvention and fixingBusinessCenters below to be leveraged for data adjustments

fixingDatePeriod.description: Specifies the fixing date relative to the reset date in terms of a business days offset and an associated set of financial business centers. Normally these offset calculation rules will be those specified in the ISDA definition for the relevant floating rate index (ISDA's Floating Rate Option). However, non-standard offset calculation rules may apply for a trade if mutually agreed by the principal parties to the transaction.  Reflects time period and multiplier (e.g. 0,-1, -2 etc.)

fixingDayType.description: In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not. If a day type of business days is specified then non-business days are ignored when calculating the offset. The financial business centers to use for determination of business days are implied by the context in which this element is used. This element must only be included when the offset is specified as a number of days. If the offset is zero days then the dayType element should not be included.

fixingBusinessDayConvention.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

fixingBusinessCenters.description: The set of business centers is used to determine whether a particular day is a business day or not

resetRateCutOffDaysOffsetPeriod.description: Specifies the number of business days before the period end date when the rate cut-off date is assumed to apply. The financial business centers associated with determining the rate cut-off date are those specified in the reset dates adjustments. The rate cut-off number of days must be a negative integer (a value of zero would imply no rate cut off applies in which case the rateCutOffDaysOffset element should not be included). The relevant rate for each reset date in the period from, and including, a rate cut-off date to, but excluding, the next applicable period end date (or, in the case of the last calculation period, the termination date) will (solely for purposes of calculating the floating amount payable on the next applicable payment date) be deemed to be the relevant rate in effect on that rate cut-off date. For example, if rate cut-off days for a daily averaging deal is -2 business days, then the refix rate applied on (period end date - 2 days) will also be applied as the reset on (period end date - 1 day), i.e. the actual number of reset dates remains the same but from the rate cut-off date until the period end date, the same refix rate is applied. Note that in the case of several calculation periods contributing to a single payment, the rate cut-off is assumed only to apply to the final calculation period contributing to that payment.

resetRateCutOffDaysOffsetDayType.description: The day type associated with the offset must imply a business days offset

resetFrequencyPeriod.description: The frequency at which reset dates occur. In the case of a weekly reset frequency, also specifies the day of the week that the reset occurs. If the reset frequency is greater than the calculation period frequency then this implies that more than one reset date is established for each calculation period and some form of rate averaging is applicable. Reflects time period (e.g. a day, week, month, year or term of the stream and multiplier (e.g. 1, 2 or 3 etc.). For example 1W

resetFrequencyWeeklyRollConvention.description: The day of the week on which a weekly reset date occurs. This element must be included if the reset frequency is defined as weekly and not otherwise

resetDateBusinessDayConvention.description: The business day convention to apply to each reset date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day in the specified financial business centers

resetDateBusinessCenters.description: The set of business centers is used to determine whether a particular day is a business day or no

notionalStepScheduleInitialValue.description: The notional amount or notional amount schedule expressed as explicit outstanding notional amounts and dates. The non-negative initial rate or amount, as the case may be. In the case of a schedule, the step dates may be subject to adjustment in accordance with any adjustments specified in calculationPeriodDatesAdjustments

notionalStepScheduleCurrency.description: The currency in which the notional amount is denominated.

fxLinkedNotionalScheduleInitialValue.description: The initial currency amount for the varying notional. This may be omitted for a forward starting swap if the Fx-linked notional value is not known at deal inception

fxLinkedNotionalScheduleVaryingNotionalC.description: The currency of the varying notional amount, i.e. the notional amount being determined periodically based on observation of a spot currency exchange rate

fxLinkedNotionalScheduleVaryingNotionalF.description: A time period, e.g. a day, week, month or year of the stream. If the periodMultiplier value is 0 (zero) then period must contain the value D (day).

In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not. If a day type of business days is specified then non-business days are ignored when calculating the offset. The financial business centers to use for determination of business days are implied by the context in which this element is used. This element must only be included when the offset is specified as a number of days. If the offset is zero days then the dayType element should not be included.
The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day
The set of business centers is used to determine whether a particular day is a business day or not
The related reference to the end date of the calculation period, where an unadjustedTerminationDate is not provided

fxLinkedNotionalScheduleSpotPrimaryRateS.description: The primary source and time for where the spot currency exchange rate observation will occur
Either a page or a reference bank published rate

fxLinkedNotionalScheduleFixingTime.description: The time at which the spot currency exchange rate will be observed. It is specified as a time in a business day calendar location, e.g. 11:00am London time

fxLinkedNotionalScheduleVaryingNotionalI.description: The dates on which interim exchanges of notional are paid. Interim exchanges will arise as a result of changes in the spot currency exchange amount or changes in the constant notional schedule (e.g. amortization).

In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not. If a day type of business days is specified then non-business days are ignored when calculating the offset. The financial business centers to use for determination of business days are implied by the context in which this element is used. This element must only be included when the offset is specified as a number of days. If the offset is zero days then the dayType element should not be included.

fixedRate.description: The fixed rate or fixed rate schedule expressed as explicit fixed rates and dates. In the case of a schedule, the step dates may be subject to adjustment in accordance with any adjustments specified in calculationPeriodDatesAdjustments. The initial rate or amount, as the case may be. An initial rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.

knownAmountInitialValue.description: The known calculation period amount or a known amount schedule expressed as explicit known amounts and dates. In the case of a schedule, the step dates may be subject to adjustment in accordance with any adjustments specified in calculationPeriodDatesAdjustments

knownAmountCurrency.description: The currency in which the known amount is denominated

knownAmountCalculationPeriodNumberOfDays.description: The number of days from the adjusted calculation period start date to the adjusted value date, calculated in accordance with the applicable day count fraction

floatingRateIndex.description: The floating rate index for floating rate calculations

floatingRateTenor.description: The ISDA Designated Maturity, i.e. the tenor of the floating rate

floatingRateCalculationParametersCalcula.description: Parameters to specify a rate calculated using an averaging or compounding formula, as described in the 2021 ISDA Defintions, section 7. Please note that when this structure is used, the "resetDates" structure will not be used. Instead, the observation rules for the calculated rate are defined within the structure

floatingRateCalculationParametersApplica.description: Specifies the applicable business days to be used for this calculation. If omitted, the business days should be defaulted from the FRO Matrix, as represented in the FRO metadata. Failing that, it should be defaulted from the default business center for the relevant currency. See the ISDA 2021 Definitions Section 7.2.1.

floatingRateCalculationParametersLookbac.description: Specifies that lookback calculation is in effect, and supplies parameters needed to support that. See the ISDA 2021 Definitions Section 7.3.2 and 7.4.2. This should not be used when the calculationMethod is CompoundedIndex

floatingRateCalculationParametersLockout.description: Specifies that lockout calculation is in effect, and supplies parameters needed to support that. See the ISDA 2021 Definitions Section 7.3.4 and 7.4.4. This should not be used when the calculationMethod is CompoundedIndex

floatingRateCalculationParametersObserva.description: The number of business days before the base date that the observations are to be shifted. If this element is omitted, the number of offset days will be as specified in the 2021 ISDA Definitions, which is typically 5.

Specifies how the observation period is to be determined relative to the basic calculation period. Options include "standard" (observation period aligns with the calculation period except for any shifts/lookbacks/lockouts, i.e. it is set in arrears), "InAdvance" (observation period is based on the prior or deemed prior calculation period plus any shifts), or "FixingDate" (observation period is based on a fixing date defined the the FpML resetDates structure; this is used only for fallback rate definitions that reference existing resetDates structures.)
Any additional business centers that are applicable to the observation shift calculation, in addition to the regular "applicableBusinessDays".

floatingRateMultiplierScheduleInitialVal.description: The initial rate or amount, as the case may be. An initial rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05

floatingRateSpreadScheduleInitialValue.description: The initial rate or amount, as the case may be. An initial rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05

floatingRateCapRateInitialValue.description: The cap rate or cap rate schedule, if any, which applies to the floating rate. The cap rate (strike) is only required where the floating rate on a swap stream is capped at a certain level. A cap rate schedule is expressed as explicit cap rates and dates and the step dates may be subject to adjustment in accordance with any adjustments specified in calculationPeriodDatesAdjustments. The cap rate is assumed to be exclusive of any spread and is a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. A cap rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05

floatingRateFloorRateInitialValue.description: The floor rate or floor rate schedule, if any, which applies to the floating rate. The floor rate (strike) is only required where the floating rate on a swap stream is floored at a certain strike level. A floor rate schedule is expressed as explicit floor rates and dates and the step dates may be subject to adjustment in accordance with any adjustments specified in calculationPeriodDatesAdjustments. The floor rate is assumed to be exclusive of any spread and is a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. A floor rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.

initialFloatingRate.description: The initial floating rate reset agreed between the principal parties involved in the trade. This is assumed to be the first required reset rate for the first regular calculation period. It should only be included when the rate is not equal to the rate published on the source implied by the floating rate index. An initial rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.

floatingRateAveragingMethod.description: If averaging is applicable, this component specifies whether a weighted or unweighted average method of calculation is to be used. The component must only be included when averaging applies.

floatingRateNegativeInterestRateTreatmen.description: The specification of any provisions for calculating payment obligations when a floating rate is negative (either due to a quoted negative floating rate or by operation of a spread that is subtracted from the floating rate)

inflationRateInflationLagPeriod.description: an offsetting period from the payment date which determines the reference period for which the inflation index is onserved. A time period multiplier, e.g. 1, 2 or 3 etc. A negative value can be used when specifying an offset relative to another date, e.g. -2 days

inflationRateIndexSource.description: The reference source such as Reuters or Bloomberg.

inflationRateInterpolationMethod.description: The method used when calculating the Inflation Index Level from multiple points - the most common is Linear.

inflationRateInitialIndexLevel.description: Initial known index level for the first calculation period

inflationRateIndexInitialDate.description: Initial Inflation rate observed, defined by month and year

inflationRateIndexFinalDate.description: Final Inflation rate observed, defined by month and year

inflationRateFallbackBondApplicable.description: The applicability of a fallback bond as defined in the 2006 ISDA Inflation Derivatives Definitions, sections 1.3 and 1.8.

inflationRateCalculationMethod.description: Indicates how to use the inflation index to calculate the payment

inflationRateCalculationStyle.description: Indicates the style of how the inflation index calculates the payment (e.g. YearOnYear, ZeroCoupon)

finalPrincipalExchangeCalculationFloored.description: To be specified only for inflation products that embed a redemption payment, e.g. inflation linked asset swap

fraDiscounting.description: Specifies whether discounting applies and, if so, what type.

compoundingMethod.description: If more that one calculation period contributes to a single payment amount this element specifies whether compounding is applicable, and if so, what compounding method is to be used. This element must only be included when more that one calculation period contributes to a single payment amount.

baseIndexValue.description: Specifies the Strike Rate of the Rate Lock Transaction agreed between the parties

dv01Currency.description: Specifies the currency of the DV01 (Dollar Value of one basis point) Amount with respect to the Rate Lock Transaction.

dv01Amount.description: Specifies the DV01 (Dollar Value of one basis point) Amount with respect to Rate Lock Transaction.

initialStubRate.description: An actual rate to apply for the initial or final stub period may have been agreed between the principal parties (in a similar way to how an initial rate may have been agreed for the first regular period). If an actual stub rate has been agreed then it would be included in this component. It will be a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. A stub rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.

principalExchangesInitialExchange.description: A true/false flag to indicate whether there is an initial exchange of principal on the effective date

principalExchangesFinalExchange.description: A true/false flag to indicate whether there is a final exchange of principal on the termination date

principalExchangesIntermediateExchange.description: A true/false flag to indicate whether there are intermediate or interim exchanges of principal during the term of the swap

cashflowMatchParameters.description: A true/false flag to indicate whether the cashflows match the parametric definition of the stream, i.e. whether the cashflows could be regenerated from the parameters without loss of information

cashflowPrincipalExchangePresentValueCur.description: The currency in which the present value is denominated

cashflowAdjustedPaymentDate.description: The adjusted payment date and associated calculation period parameters required to calculate the actual or projected payment amount. A list of payment calculation period elements may be ordered in the document by ascending adjusted payment date

principalExchangeAmount.description: The principal exchange amount. This amount should be positive if the stream payer is paying the exchange amount and signed negative if they are receiving it

settlementCurrency.description: The currency that stream settles in (to support swaps that settle in a currency different from the notional currency).

nonDeliverableSettlementFxFixingDatePeri.description: The date, when expressed as a relative date, on which the currency rate will be determined for the purpose of specifying the amount in deliverable currency.

nonDeliverableSettlementFxFixingDateDayT.description: In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not. If a day type of business days is specified then non-business days are ignored when calculating the offset. The financial business centers to use for determination of business days are implied by the context in which this element is used. This element must only be included when the offset is specified as a number of days. If the offset is zero days then the dayType element should not be included.

nonDeliverableSettlementFxFixingDateBusi.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day

nonDeliverableSettlementRateOption.description: The rate source for the conversion to the settlement currency. This source is specified through a scheme that reflects the terms of the Annex A to the 1998 Fx and Currency Option Definitions.

stepDate.description: On each step date the associated step value becomes effective. A list of steps may be ordered in the document by ascending step date. This day may be subject to adjustment in accordance with a business day convention linked to the Calculation Periods.

stepValue.description: A parametric representation of the step schedule, i.e. parameters used to generate the schedule.

floatingRateIndex.description:
Specifies how the initial stub amount is calculated. A single floating rate tenor different to that used for the regular part of the calculation periods schedule may be specified, or two floating tenors may be specified. If two floating rate tenors are specified then Linear Interpolation (in accordance with the 2000 ISDA Definitions, Section 8.3. Interpolation) is assumed to apply. Alternatively, an actual known stub rate or stub amount may be specified. 
The rates to be applied to the initial or final stub may be the linear interpolation of two different rates. While the majority of the time, the rate indices will be the same as that specified in the stream and only the tenor itself will be different, it is possible to specift two different rates. For example, a 2 month stub period may use the linear interpolation of a 1 month and 3 month rate. The different rates would be specified in this component. Note that a maximum of two rates can be specified. If a stub period uses the same floating rate index, including tenor, as the regular calculation periods then this should not be specified again within this component, i.e. the stub calculation period amount component may not need to be specified even if there is an initial or final stub period. If a stub period uses a different floating rate index compared to the regular calculation periods then this should be specified within this component. If specified here, they are likely to have id attributes, allowing them to be referenced from within the cashflows component.

floatingRatePeriod.description: The ISDA Designated Maturity, i.e. the tenor of the floating rate

premiumPayer.description: The party responsible for paying the premium payment

premiumReceiver.description: The party responsible for receiving the premium payment

unadjustedPremiumPaymentDate.description: The payment date. This date is subject to adjustment in accordance with any applicable business day convention.

premiumPaymentDateBusinessDayConvention.description: The business day convention used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

premiumPaymentDateBusinessCenters.description: The business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

forwardPremium.description: Indicates if the Swaption premium payment amount is live or the payment has been settled at the time of the cancellation event.

americanExerciseRelativeCommencementDate.description: A date specified as some offset to another date (the anchor date)
In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not
The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

americanExerciseUnadjustedExpirationDate.description: The last day within an exercise period for an American style option. For a European style option it is the only day within the exercise period.

americanExerciseExpirationDateBusinessDa.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

americanExerciseExpirationDateBusinessCe.description: The business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

americanExerciseRelativeExpirationDatePe.description: A date specified as some offset to another date (the anchor date)

americanExerciseRelativeExpirationDateDa.description: In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not

americanExerciseRelativeExpirationDateBu.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

americanExerciseExpirationDateRelativeTo.description: A date specified as some offset to another date (the anchor date).

americanExerciseRelevantUnderlyingRelati.description: The date on the underlying set by the exercise of an option. What this date is depends on the option (e.g. in a swaption it is the swap effective date, in an extendible/cancelable provision it is the swap termination date).
In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not
The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

americanExerciseRelevantUnderlyingDateSc.description: A date specified as some offset to another date (the anchor date).
A date specified as some offset to another date (the anchor date).

americanExerciseEarliestExerciseTime.description: The earliest time at which notice of exercise can be given by the buyer to the seller (or seller's agent) i) on the expriation date, in the case of a European style option, (ii) on each bermuda option exercise date and the expiration date, in the case of a Bermuda style option the commencement date to, and including, the expiration date , in the case of an American option.

americanExerciseLatestExerciseTime.description: For a Bermuda or American style option, the latest time on an exercise business day (excluding the expiration date) within the exercise period that notice can be given by the buyer to the seller or seller's agent. Notice of exercise given after this time will be deemed to have been given on the next exercise business day.

americanExerciseExpirationTime.description: The latest time for exercise on expirationDate.

europeanExerciseUnadjustedExpirationDate.description: For a European style option it is the only day within the exercise period.

europeanExerciseExpirationDateBusinessDa.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

europeanExerciseExpirationDateBusinessCe.description: The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

europeanExerciseRelativeExpirationDatePe.description: A date specified as some offset to another date (the anchor date)

europeanExerciseRelativeExpirationDateDa.description: In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not

europeanExerciseRelativeExpirationDateBu.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

europeanExerciseRelevantUnderlyingUnadju.description: The date on the underlying set by the exercise of an option. What this date is depends on the option (e.g. in a swaption it is the swap effective date, in an extendible/cancelable provision it is the swap termination date)

europeanExerciseRelevantUnderlyingDateBu.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

europeanExerciseEarliestExerciseTime.description: The earliest time at which notice of exercise can be given by the buyer to the seller (or seller's agent) i) on the expriation date, in the case of a European style option, (ii) on each bermuda option exercise date and the expiration date, in the case of a Bermuda style option the commencement date to, and including, the expiration date , in the case of an American option.

europeanExerciseExpirationTime.description: The latest time for exercise on expirationDate.

europeanExerciseFee.description: A fee to be paid on exercise. This could be represented as an amount or a rate and notional reference on which to apply the rate.

bermudanExerciseUnadjustedDate.description: The dates the define the Bermuda option exercise dates and the expiration date. The last specified date is assumed to be the expiration date. The dates can either be specified as a series of explicit dates and associated adjustments or as a series of dates defined relative to another schedule of dates, for example, the calculation period start dates. Where a relative series of dates are defined the first and last possible exercise dates can be separately specified.

bermudanExerciseDateBusinessDayConventio.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

bermudanExerciseDateBusinessCenters.description: The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

bermudanExerciseRelativeDatePeriod.description: A series of dates specified as some offset to another series of dates (the anchor dates).

bermudanExerciseRelativeDateDayType.description: In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not. If a day type of business days is specified then non-business days are ignored when calculating the offset. The financial business centers to use for determination of business days are implied by the context in which this element is used. This element must only be included when the offset is specified as a number of days. If the offset is zero days then the dayType element should not be included.

bermudanExerciseRelativeDateBusinessDayC.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

bermudanExerciseRelevantUnderlyingUnadju.description: The date on the underlying set by the exercise of an option. What this date is depends on the option (e.g. in a swaption it is the swap effective date, in an extendible/cancelable provision it is the swap termination date).

bermudanExerciseRelevantUnderlyingDateBu.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.
The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

bermudanExerciseRelevantUnderlyingRelati.description: A series of dates specified as some offset to another series of dates (the anchor dates).
The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.
The first date of a schedule. This can be used to restrict the range of values in a reference series of dates.
The last date of a schedule. This can be used to restrict the range of values in a reference series of dates.

bermudanExerciseEarliestExerciseTime.description: The earliest time at which notice of exercise can be given by the buyer to the seller (or seller's agent) i) on the expriation date, in the case of a European style option, (ii) on each bermuda option exercise date and the expiration date, in the case of a Bermuda style option the commencement date to, and including, the expiration date , in the case of an American option.

bermudanExerciseLatestExerciseTime.description: For a Bermuda or American style option, the latest time on an exercise business day (excluding the expiration date) within the exercise period that notice can be given by the buyer to the seller or seller's agent. Notice of exercise given after this time will be deemed to have been given on the next exercise business day.

bermudanExerciseExpirationTime.description: The latest time for exercise on expirationDate.

exerciseProcedureManualFallbackExercise.description: If fallback exercise is specified then the notional amount of the underlying swap, not previously exercised under the swaption, will be automatically exercised at the expiration time on the expiration date if at such time the buyer is in-the-money, provided that the difference between the settlement rate and the fixed rate under the relevant underlying swap is not less than one tenth of a percentage point (0.10% or 0.001). The term in-the-money is assumed to have the meaning defined in the 2000 ISDA Definitions, Section 17.4. In-the-money.

exerciseProcedureFollowUpConfirmation.description: A flag to indicate whether follow-up confirmation of exercise (written or electronic) is required following telephonic notice by the buyer to the seller or seller's agent

exerciseProcedureLimitedRightToConfirm.description: Has the meaning defined as part of the 1997 ISDA Government Bond Option Definitions, section 4.5 Limited Right to Confirm Exercise. If present, (i) the Seller may request the Buyer to confirm its intent if not done on or before the expiration time on the Expiration date (ii) specific rules will apply in relation to the settlement mode

cashSettlementValuationTime.description: The time of the cash settlement valuation date when the cash settlement amount will be determined according to the cash settlement method if the parties have not otherwise been able to agree the cash settlement amount.

cashSettlementValuationDatePeriod.description: The date on which the cash settlement amount will be determined according to the cash settlement method if the parties have not otherwise been able to agree the cash settlement amount. Time period and multiplier.

cashSettlementValuationDateDayType.description: In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not. If a day type of business days is specified then non-business days are ignored when calculating the offset. The financial business centers to use for determination of business days are implied by the context in which this element is used. This element must only be included when the offset is specified as a number of days. If the offset is zero days then the dayType element should not be included.

cashSettlementValuationDateBusinessDayCo.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

cashSettlementUnadjustedPaymentDates.description:
A series of dates that shall be subject to adjustment if they would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day in the specified business centers, together with the convention for adjusting the date
The date on which the cash settlement amount will be paid, subject to adjustment in accordance with any applicable business day convention. This component would not be present for a mandatory early termination provision where the cash settlement payment date is the mandatory early termination date.

cashSettlementPaymentDateBusinessDayConv.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

cashSettlementPaymentDateBusinessCenters.description: The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

cashSettlementRelativePaymentDatePeriod.description: A date specified as some offset to another date (the anchor date). Date multiplier and period

cashSettlementRelativePaymentDateDayType.description: In the case of an offset specified as a number of days, this element defines whether consideration is given as to whether a day is a good business day or not. If a day type of business days is specified then non-business days are ignored when calculating the offset. The financial business centers to use for determination of business days are implied by the context in which this element is used. This element must only be included when the offset is specified as a number of days. If the offset is zero days then the dayType element should not be included.

cashSettlementRelativePaymentDateBusines.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

cashSettlementPaymentDateBusinessDateRan.description: An ISDA defined cash settlement method used for the determination of the applicable cash settlement amount. The first date of a date range
The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.
The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

cashSettlementMidMarketValuationIndicati.description: The currency, or currencies, in which the cash settlement amount(s) will be calculated and settled. While the order in which the currencies are stated is unimportant, the cash settlement currency or currencies must correspond to one or both of the constituent currencies of the swap transaction
This may be used to whaty type of CSA (credit support annex/agreement) is to be used for cash settlement purposes

A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount. If institutions are not specified, it is assumed that reference institutions will be agreed between the parties on the exercise date, or in the case of swap transaction to which mandatory early termination is applicable, the cash settlement valuation date
This may be used to indicate the discount rate to be used for cash collateral for cash settlement purposes
This may be used to indicate the currency of cash collateral for cash settlement purposes.
This may be used to indicate the interest rate to be used for cash collateral for cash settlement purposes.
This may be used to indicate the currency of cash collateral for cash settlement purposes.
This may be used to indicate the interest rate to be used for cash collateral for cash settlement purposes.

The currency, or currencies, in which the cash settlement amount(s) will be calculated and settled. While the order in which the currencies are stated is unimportant, the cash settlement currency or currencies must correspond to one or both of the constituent currencies of the swap transaction.
This may be used to define what type of CSA (credit support annex/agreement) is to be used for cash settlement purposes.
This may be used to indicate the discount rate to be used for cash collateral for cash settlement purposes.

cashSettlementMidMarketValuationCalculat.description: The currency, or currencies, in which the cash settlement amount(s) will be calculated and settled. While the order in which the currencies are stated is unimportant, the cash settlement currency or currencies must correspond to one or both of the constituent currencies of the swap transaction
This may be used to whaty type of CSA (credit support annex/agreement) is to be used for cash settlement purposes
This may be used to indicate the currency of cash collateral for cash settlement purposes.
This may be used to indicate the interest rate to be used for cash collateral for cash settlement purposes.
This may be used to indicate the discount rate to be used for cash collateral for cash settlement purposes.

cashSettlementReplacementValueFirmQuotat.description: ISDA defined cash settlement methods based on replacement value. The currency, or currencies, in which the cash settlement amount(s) will be calculated and settled. While the order in which the currencies are stated is unimportant, the cash settlement currency or currencies must correspond to one or both of the constituent currencies of the swap transaction.
A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount.
This may be used to specify which party is protected (e.g. under Replacement Value cash settlement methods)
This may be used to specify which party is protected (e.g. under Replacement Value cash settlement methods)
An ISDA defined cash settlement method used for the determination of the applicable cash settlement amount. The method is defined in the 2021 ISDA Definitions, Section 18.2.4.
This may be used to indicate that "prescribed documentation adjustment" is applicable.

cashSettlementReplacementValueCalculatio.description: This may be used to indicate the currency of cash collateral for cash settlement purposes
This may be used to specify which party is protected (e.g. under Replacement Value cash settlement methods)
The party specific party that is referenced

cashSettlementCashPriceMethodCashSettlem.description: A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount. If institutions are not specified, it is assumed that reference institutions will be agreed between the parties on the exercise date, or in the case of swap transaction to which mandatory early termination is applicable, the cash settlement valuation date

cashSettlementCashPriceMethodSettlementR.description: A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount. If institutions are not specified, it is assumed that reference institutions will be agreed between the parties on the exercise date, or in the case of swap transaction to which mandatory early termination is applicable, the cash settlement valuation date

cashSettlementCashPriceMethodCashSettlem.description: The currency in which the cash settlement amount will be calculated and settled

cashSettlementCashPriceMethodCashQuotati.description: Which rate quote is to be observed, either Bid, Mid, Offer or Exercising Party Pays

cashSettlementCashPriceAlternateMethodSe.description: A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount. If institutions are not specified, it is assumed that reference institutions will be agreed between the parties on the exercise date, or in the case of swap transaction to which mandatory early termination is applicable, the cash settlement valuation date

cashSettlementCashPriceAlternateMethodCa.description: The currency in which the cash settlement amount will be calculated and settled.

cashSettlementCashPriceAlternateMethodQu.description: Which rate quote is to be observed, either Bid, Mid, Offer or Exercising Party Pays

cashSettlementParYieldCurveAdjustedMetho.description: A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount. If institutions are not specified, it is assumed that reference institutions will be agreed between the parties on the exercise date, or in the case of swap transaction to which mandatory early termination is applicable, the cash settlement valuation date
The method for obtaining a settlement rate. This may be from some information source (e.g. Reuters) or from a set of reference banks
Which rate quote is to be observed, either Bid, Mid, Offer or Exercising Party Pays

cashSettlementZeroCouponYieldAdjustedMet.description: The method for obtaining a settlement rate

A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount. If institutions are not specified, it is assumed that reference institutions will be agreed between the parties on the exercise date, or in the case of swap transaction to which mandatory early termination is applicable, the cash settlement valuation date
Which rate quote is to be observed, either Bid, Mid, Offer or Exercising Party Pays

cashSettlementCrossCurrencyMethodSettlem.description: A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount. If institutions are not specified, it is assumed that reference institutions will be agreed between the parties on the exercise date, or in the case of swap transaction to which mandatory early termination is applicable, the cash settlement valuation date

cashSettlementCrossCurrencyMethodCashSet.description: The currency, or currencies, in which the cash settlement amount(s) will be calculated and settled. While the order in which the currencies are stated is unimportant, the cash settlement currency or currencies must correspond to one or both of the constituent currencies of the swap transaction

cashSettlementCrossCurrencyMethodQuotati.description: Which rate quote is to be observed, either Bid, Mid, Offer or Exercising Party Pays

cashSettlementCollateralizedCashPriceMet.description: The method for obtaining a settlement rate

A container for a set of reference institutions. These reference institutions may be called upon to provide rate quotations as part of the method to determine the applicable cash settlement amount. If institutions are not specified, it is assumed that reference institutions will be agreed between the parties on the exercise date, or in the case of swap transaction to which mandatory early termination is applicable, the cash settlement valuation date.
Which rate quote is to be observed, either Bid, Mid, Offer or Exercising Party Pays

cashSettlementParYieldCurveUnadjustedMet.description: The method for obtaining a settlement rate
Which rate quote is to be observed, either Bid, Mid, Offer or Exercising Party Pays

mandatoryEarlyTerminationUnadjustedDate.description: A mandatory early termination provision to terminate the swap at fair value

mandatoryEarlyTerminationDateBusinessDay.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

mandatoryEarlyTerminationDateBusinessCen.description: The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

calculationAgent.description: The ISDA Calculation Agent responsible for performing duties associated with an optional/mandatory early termination.

followUpConfirmation.description: A flag to indicate whether follow-up confirmation of exercise (written or electronic) is required following telephonic notice by the buyer to the seller or seller's agent

buyer.description: The buyer, ie. pays for this instrument and receives the rights defined by it.

seller.description: The seller i.e. that grants the rights defined by this instrument and in return receives a payment for it.

mandatoryEarlyTerminationDateBusinessCen.description: The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

followUpConfirmation.description: A flag to indicate whether follow-up confirmation of exercise (written or electronic) is required following telephonic notice by the buyer to the seller or seller's agent

discrepancyClause.description: This element is optional and is intended to indicate if additional Discrepancy Clause details are applicable to the underlying IRS or OIS with a Cancellable Provision

discrepancyClauseTitle.description: If a Cancellable Discrepancy Clause is applicable on a Cancellable IRS or OIS transaction, this element will specify the name assigned to the underlying Discrepancy Clause language agreed between two parties

discrepancyClauseAgreementDate.description: This element indicates the date on which the Discrepancy Clause Language was agreed

additionalPaymentPayer.description: A reference to the party responsible for making the additional payment

additionalPaymentReceiver.description: A reference to the party responsible for receving the additional payment

additionalPaymentAmount.description: The future value notional is normally only required for BRL CDI Swaps. The value is calculated as follows: Future Value Notional = Notional Amount * (1 + Fixed Rate) ^ (Fixed Rate Day Count Fraction). The currency should always match that expressed in the notional schedule. The value date should match the adjusted termination date

additionalPaymentCurrency.description: The currency in which the future notional amount is denominated.

additionalPaymentUnadjustedPaymentDate.description: A mandatory early termination provision to terminate the swap at fair value

additionalPaymentBusinessDayConvention.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.

additionalPaymentBusinessCenters.description: The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

additionalPaymentType.description: A classification of the type of fee or additional payment, e.g. brokerage, upfront fee etc

independantAmountPayer.description: A reference to the party responsible for making the payment

independantAmountReceiver.description: A reference to the party responsible for receving the additional payment

independantAmountUnadjustedPaymentDate.description: The payment date subject to adjustment

independantAmountUnadjustedPaymentBusine.description: The convention for adjusting a date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business day.
The business day convention and financial business centers used for adjusting the date if it would otherwise fall on a day that is not a business date in the specified business centers.

independantPaymentAmount.description: The future value notional is normally only required for BRL CDI Swaps. The value is calculated as follows: Future Value Notional = Notional Amount * (1 + Fixed Rate) ^ (Fixed Rate Day Count Fraction). The currency should always match that expressed in the notional schedule. The value date should match the adjusted termination date

independantPaymentCurrency.description: The currency in which the future notional amount is denominated.

bondReferenceInstrumentId.description: Reference to a bond underlyer to represent an asset swap or Condition Precedent Bond

bondReferenceConditionPrecedent.description: To indicate whether the Condition Precedent Bond is applicable. The swap contract is only valid if the bond is issued and if there is any dispute over the terms of fixed stream then the bond terms would be used

bondReferenceDiscrepancyClause.description: The payment date subject to adjustment

bondCouponRate.description: Specifies the coupon rate (expressed in percentage) of a fixed income security or convertible bond

bondReferenceMaturity.description: The date when the principal amount of a security becomes due and payable.

bondMaturityYear.description: This field specifies the Bond Maturity year listed on the Municipal market data for the AAA municipal Bonds for a Rate Lock

spreadCalculationMethod.description: Code values for different methods of spread calculation

associatedBondId.description: The underlying bond details if the swap price was negotiated as a spread over underlying bond reference instruments. Note that this element should not be present for a FRA, OIS, CapFloor or Swaption trade

associatedBondName.description: A free format description of the bond instrument.

associatedBondQuantity.description: The bond face amount expressed as a percentage of the notional amount of the swap. 50 percent would be represented as 0.5

associatedBondFaceAmount.description: The face amount of the bond

associatedBondPriceType.description: A classification of the format used to express the bond price and hence how the value in the swBondPrice element should be interpreted. For example, whether the price is in a decimal format or whether the fractional part is expressed in 32nds of 1% of par value etc

associatedBondPrice.description: The clean bond price expressed in a format consistent with the price type specified by the swPriceType element

novationDate.description: Date when the novation was executed

novationTradeDate.description: Date when the novation was agreed

novatedAmount.description: The agreed amount that was novated

novatedCurrency.description: The currency of the amount that was novated

fullFirstCalculationPeriod.description: The applicability of the Full First Calculation Period as defined in the 2004 ISDA Novation Definitions.

firstPeriodStartDate.description: The start date of the calculation period if the date falls before the effective date. It must only be specified if it is not equal to the effective date. This date may be subject to adjustment in accordance with a business day convention

economicAmendmentType.description: FpML Extension. A flag to identify if the trade is a part of an economic amendment e.g Transition from IBOR to RFRs

economicAmendmentReason.description: FpML Extension. A field capturing the reason for economic amendment

eventTradeDate.description: FpML Extension. For MW. this will be present if the trade has a trade status of Exit, Cancelled or Amended and will contain a date that corresponds to the trade date of the post trade event

eventEffectiveDate.description: FpML Extension. For MW, this element will be present if the trade has a trade status of Exit, Cancelled or Amended and will contain a date that corresponds to the effective date of the post trade event

fee.description: One or more Fees associated to the post trade event

feePayer.description: Used to capture the payer of the fee associated to a post trade event, for example the novation fee betwee the OR and EE

feeReceiver.description: Used to capture the receiver of the fee associated to a post trade event, for example the novation fee betwee the OR and EE

feeAmount.description: The fee amount to be exchanged

feeCurrency.description: The currency of the fee amount to be exchanged

feeUnadjustedDate.description: The unadjusted payment date for the  fee amount to be exchanged

feeBusinessDayConvention.description: The business day convention used for adjusting the payment date

feeBusinessCenters.description: The set of business centers used to determine whether the fee payment date is a business day

feeType.description: A reference to the payment type

settlementAgent.description: The agent involved in settling the trade. In the case of bilateral MW trades, where customers adopt LSEG's Swap Agent service, this will indicate SwapAgent Ltd.

settlementAgentPartyId.description: The settlement agent's MW entity reference (BIC)

settlementAgentModel.description: The settlement agent's calculation model CMS or STM

settlementAgentStatus.description: The status echo'ed back from the settlement agent

settlementAgentReference.description: Any associated references to the settlementAgentStatus

settlementAgentAgreement.description: Any other agreement configured against the settlement agency.

settlementAgentAgreementSubType.description: The sub type related to any other agreement configured against the settlement agency.

initialExchangeSentToCLS.description: Indicates payment notification to CLS for initial exchange.

initialExchangeCLSSettlementStatus.description: Indicates the CLS status of the initial exchange

initialExchangeCLSSettlementStatusReason.description: Indicates the reason for the CLS status of the initial exchange

finalExchangeSentToCLS.description: Indicates payment notification to CLS for final exchange

finalExchangeCLSSettlementStatus.description: Indicates the CLS status of the final exchange

finalExchangeCLSSettlementStatusReason.description: Indicates the reason for the CLS status of the final exchange

CompoundingMethodEnum.description: Flat - Compounding excludes the spread. Note that the first compounding period has it's interest calculated including any spread then subsequent periods compound this at a rate excluding the spread, None - No compounding is to be applied, Straight - Straight compounding, compounding includes the spread, SpreadExclusive - Spread Exclusive compounding
